meanings.definition: To bite or chew on something repeatedly
meanings.sent1: The hungry squirrel gnaws on the acorn.
meanings.sent2: The puppy gnaws on its favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The beaver gnaws on the wood to build its dam.
meanings.sent4: Time gnaws away at the old wooden fence.
meanings.sent5: The termite gnaws through the wooden floor, causing damage.

meanings.definition: To cause persistent discomfort or anxiety
meanings.sent1: The worry gnaws at her mind all night.
meanings.sent2: The guilt gnaws at him, making it hard to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The suspense of the movie gnaws at my nerves.
meanings.sent4: The uncertainty gnaws at his confidence like a hungry mouse.
meanings.sent5: The fear of failure gnaws at her determination to succeed.
